# la_matrix_rows(_:) | Apple Developer Documentation

- [ Accelerate ](/documentation/accelerate)

Function# la_matrix_rows(_:)

iOS 8.0–14.0DeprecatediPadOS 8.0–14.0DeprecatedMac Catalyst 13.1–14.0DeprecatedmacOS 10.10–11.0DeprecatedtvOS 8.0–14.0DeprecatedvisionOS 1.0–1.0DeprecatedwatchOS 1.0–7.0Deprecated

```
func la_matrix_rows(_ matrix: la_object_t) -> la_count_t
```

Deprecated

This API is deprecated, please use BLAS and LAPACK

## [Discussion](/documentation/Accelerate/la_matrix_rows(_:)#discussion)

Get the number of rows in a matrix.

If the argument has an error status, zero is returned. If the argument is a vector, the number of rows may be 1 or length(vector) depending on the orientation of the vector. If the argument is a matrix, the number of rows is returned. Otherwise, zero is returned.
